Overall, it's a recommended spot for food lovers looking to explore new flavors in the city.

formattedAddress: 750 Spadina Ave. unit 1, Toronto, ON M5S 2Y4, Canada
reviews: Majestic Shawarma is a highly recommended dining spot in the GTA, particularly for those craving authentic Middle Eastern cuisine. Customers rave about the Chicken Shawarma Platter and the shawarma wrap, both noted for their juicy and flavorful fillings, complemented by fresh, vibrant toppings. The atmosphere is friendly, enhanced by the entertaining personality of the owner, making every visit enjoyable. Many visitors highlight the generous portions, especially the well-seasoned rice and crispy fries that round out their meals. The cleanliness and efficiency of the establishment further contribute to a stellar dining experience. While indoor seating is limited, the inviting patio offers a comfortable alternative. Whether you’re stopping by for lunch or dinner, this place promises to satisfy your taste buds with its delicious offerings. Don't miss out on this gem if you're a shawarma lover!

formattedAddress: 746 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1E9, Canada
reviews: Shawarma West is a standout option for anyone craving shawarma in the downtown area of Toronto. The shawarmas are praised for their freshness and juiciness, packed with a multitude of veggies and toppings that create a flavorful explosion with every bite. In addition to shawarmas, the falafel is delightfully served over a refreshing bed of salad, enhancing the dining experience. Customers recommend trying the souvlaki platter as well, which is part of a fantastic deal currently offering two meals for $29.99 that includes fries and drinks. The Beef Philly Cheese wrap is also worth a try, being a popular choice among diners. The service is exceptional, with staff members like Harsh, Aniket, and Akshat providing attentive and friendly service, making the meal even more enjoyable. Despite the seating being a bit uncomfortable, cleanliness and speed of service are noteworthy. Overall, it's an ideal spot for a satisfying lunch or dinner without breaking the bank, ensuring diners leave feeling full and content.

formattedAddress: 2313 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4P 2C6, Canada
reviews: This restaurant is praised for offering fantastic value, particularly for its generous portions and fresh, authentic Middle Eastern cuisine. The highlight dishes include the chicken shawarma, which is described as tender and juicy, served with fresh vegetables and flavorful hummus. Reviewers also appreciate the perfectly cooked fries that accompany the meal. The atmosphere is inviting and charming, with exceptional customer service that enhances the dining experience. One standout feature is the house-made sauces that add unique flavors to the dishes, especially a noteworthy green sauce. Many recommend indulging in the freshly squeezed orange juice for dessert, a delightful treat that rounds off the meal perfectly. This spot is ideal for a quick and satisfying lunch or dinner, and diners express their eagerness to return often. Overall, this eatery is highly recommended, especially for shawarma enthusiasts looking for a tasty, hearty meal.

formattedAddress: 504 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1Y3, Canada
reviews: This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience with a focus on Middle Eastern cuisine. Their falafel stands out as a highlight, praised for its outstanding flavor, alongside delicious eggplants and hummus. Many reviews commend the variety of dishes available, including slim plates with salad and samosas, which cater to diverse dietary needs. The service is consistently described as friendly and attentive, with staff going the extra mile to ensure customers have a great experience. During events, their catered meals have impressed students and professionals alike, showcasing well-presented entrees and authentic flavors. Guests enjoy the freshly baked pita bread and the sweet baklava for dessert, rounding out a fantastic meal. Though the seating options are limited, the restaurant is a great choice for healthy takeout. Overall, patrons express strong intentions to return for more delightful meals at this gem of a restaurant.

formattedAddress: 898 College St, Toronto, ON M6H 1A4, Canada
reviews: Shawarma Moose has garnered mixed reviews, though many diners are enthusiastic about the restaurant's offerings. Initially, customers enjoyed well-seasoned chicken shawarma served over cinnamon rice, which provided a unique flavor. However, some subsequent visits revealed inconsistencies in quality, with reports of overly fatty meat and gristle leading to disappointment. Despite this, popular dishes like chicken poutine, beef saj wraps, and fries remain crowd favorites, with many praising the juicy chicken shawarma and generous portion sizes. The friendly and accommodating staff enhance the dining experience, and customers appreciate the reasonable pricing, especially with daily deals. The small seating area can be a drawback, but the quick service makes it an appealing spot for late-night cravings. Overall, while some diners have faced issues, many recommend Shawarma Moose for its delicious flavors and welcoming atmosphere.

formattedAddress: 224 Ossington Ave, Toronto, ON M6J 2Z9, Canada
reviews: Haifa Room is a cozy Middle Eastern restaurant with a small yet inviting atmosphere, perfect for intimate meals or accommodating larger groups. The menu features a variety of dishes such as the flavorful House Hummus served with pita, savory Lamb Tartare, and delicious Loaded Eggplant, which garnered praise from first-time tasters. For dessert, the warm Knafe offered a delightful sweet and salty experience. While unfamiliar dishes like the Fried Chicken Bites and Grilled Broccolini showcased promising flavors, some guests noted inconsistencies, such as the absence of Charred Cabbage and underwhelming side Potatoes that failed to stand out alongside the steak. The dining experience, though promising, was marred by some service hiccups, including prolonged wait times for food and check requests. As for drinks, the restaurant's Demeter cocktails received favorable mentions, adding to the overall appeal of the vibrant space. Many guests recommend exploring the takeout options, which seemed to offer better value and portion sizes compared to the dine-in menu. Overall, Haifa Room delivers delicious Middle Eastern cuisine, albeit with some room for improvement in service and dish presentation.

formattedAddress: 45 Carlton St., Toronto, ON M5B 2H9, Canada
reviews: This restaurant is a popular spot for a quick and affordable meal, offering a $3.99 shawarma deal that's hard to beat. The beef and chicken shawarma plates are particularly praised, with customers highlighting the tender meat, flavorful rice, and tasty sauces, including hummus and tahini. While some diners appreciate the simplicity of just meat and rice, others have found the falafel disappointing and lacking flavor. The atmosphere is casual, ideal for a quick meal on the go, and the presence of friendly staff adds a personal touch to the dining experience. Regulars appreciate the mix of beef and chicken for its enhanced flavor profile, and many have developed loyalty to the place, noting how the staff remembers their orders. Despite the limited menu and service style, the steady stream of customers indicates a strong following. Overall, this restaurant is particularly favored for brunch or a rapid dinner option amidst the hustle and bustle of nearby shops.

formattedAddress: 901 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3H5, Canada
editorialSummary: Popular local chain outpost for falafels, shawarma wraps, combo plates & daily meal deals.
reviews: Ali Baba's Middle Eastern Cuisine is a standout restaurant that offers a delightful dining experience whether for lunch or dinner. On my recent visit, I enjoyed the fantastic veggie platter featuring falafel, garlic sauce, potatoes, and rice which was both tasty and offered great value. The daily specials are a highlight, providing a range of flavorful dishes that showcase the richness of Middle Eastern cuisine. The chicken shawarma, recommended by other patrons, is particularly noteworthy for its high-quality meat and fresh toppings, ensuring every bite is satisfying and delicious. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the staff are friendly, making for a pleasant dining experience. Cleanliness is a priority, with the establishment maintained meticulously. Complement your meal with their refreshing mango passion fruit juice, which is highly praised. Overall, Ali Baba's is a gem worth visiting, transforming an ordinary meal into something extraordinary.

formattedAddress: 4 Walmer Rd, Toronto, ON M5R 2W3, Canada
reviews: This restaurant is highly praised for its delicious and generous portions, making it a favorite for corporate lunches, where dishes are delivered on time and cater to various dietary restrictions. While one reviewer expressed disappointment over the reduced size of fish portions in their seafood combo and high prices without the same value, others emphasized the overall taste of dishes such as flavorful salads and confidently called the samosas the best in Toronto. Particularly noted are the chicken samosas, which are beloved for their melt-in-your-mouth texture and inviting blend of spices—perfect for cold winter days. The staff is also highlighted for providing exceptional service, contributing to a wonderful dining experience. Despite some negative experiences regarding the lack of air conditioning and varying food quality over the years, many loyal customers continue to support this establishment. Overall, the restaurant offers a mix of flavors and an inviting atmosphere that keeps patrons returning.

formattedAddress: 250 Eglinton Ave E, Toronto, ON M4P 1K2, Canada
reviews: Shawarma Royale offers a delightful dining experience, praised for its fresh and delicious food at great value. The standout dish is the chicken shawarma bowl, which features moist chicken served over flavorful rice, reminiscent of pilaf rather than the ordinary dry yellow rice found elsewhere. Guests have enjoyed the generous portions, though some have noted a desire for more meat in their bowls, particularly with the beef and lamb options. The ambiance is warm and inviting, contributing to the overall enjoyable atmosphere. The friendly and attentive staff enhance the experience, ensuring diners feel welcome throughout their visit. Compliments abound for the flavorful shawarma, considered the best by many, and the option to try new bowls for just $9.99 adds to its appeal. Cleanliness is prioritized within the restaurant, setting it apart from competitors nearby. With a solid overall rating of 7.9 out of 10, Shawarma Royale is quickly becoming a go-to spot for both locals and newcomers in downtown Toronto.

formattedAddress: 357 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 1S1, Canada
editorialSummary: Popular local chain outpost for falafels, shawarma wraps, combo plates & daily meal deals.
reviews: At this restaurant, diners rave about the generous portions and flavorful dishes, making it a must-try. The Family Mix is a standout favorite among groups, and many guests have enjoyed delightful options like the falafel, chicken wraps, and shawarma platters, all freshly prepared and bursting with homemade taste. The hummus chicken bowl has also received high praise for its freshness and attention to detail. Reviewers appreciate the welcoming and comfortable atmosphere, alongside the spectacular service from friendly and helpful staff. Guests noted the thoughtful touch of complimentary appetizers while waiting for their meals. Although some mentioned that the music can be a bit loud, particularly late at night, it did not overshadow their positive dining experiences. Overall, this restaurant is highly recommended for its excellent food and value, promising a satisfying breakfast, brunch, or dinner.

formattedAddress: 34 King St E, Toronto, ON M5C 2A1, Canada
reviews: Pita Lite offers a variety of flavorful dishes, particularly their chicken shawarma pita, shish taouk, and kebabs, paired with delicious rice and sauces, making it a solid choice for lunch or dinner. Diners appreciate the generous portion sizes and reasonable prices, notably the $9.99 shawarma plate deal that includes rice. The small seating area is conveniently located on King Street, ideal for downtown workers looking for a quick meal. However, customers have reported mixed experiences regarding service; while some praise the politeness of the staff and the cleanliness of the restaurant, others recount frustrating encounters with order mistakes leading to unsatisfactory resolutions. One customer noted a particularly disappointing experience where their order was incorrectly handled, leaving them feeling undervalued. Despite the inconsistent service, many recommend the restaurant for its budget-friendly meals and good food quality. Overall, Pita Lite is recognized for its tasty offerings, though diners may want to manage their expectations regarding customer service.

formattedAddress: 768 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1T8, Canada
reviews: This restaurant specializes in shawarma but also offers a unique selection of dishes such as fish and beef with rice, which are favorites among regular customers. While many praise their hummus and the delightful samosas as tasty quick bites, reviews are mixed regarding the freshness of the food. Some diners have experienced stale and dry chicken, particularly during slower periods, leading to dissatisfaction and discarded meals. The chicken shawarma plate is reportedly generous, especially when paired with rice, hummus, and garlic sauce, which enhances the flavor profile. Customers also highlight the friendly staff, making the dining experience more enjoyable. However, there have been concerning reports of food safety issues, including inedible meals and a dangerous metal object found in a chicken wrap that caused dental damage. Despite some negative experiences, the restaurant is noted for its affordable prices and outdoor seating that adds to a refreshing atmosphere. Lastly, their baklava is a sweet favorite among patrons, solidifying their appeal to both shawarma and dessert lovers.

formattedAddress: 49 Front St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1B3, Canada
displayName: The Sultan's Tent and Cafe Moroc
editorialSummary: French-Moroccan fare is served in the front cafe, with belly dancers & plush divans in a back room.
reviews: This restaurant offers a captivating dining experience with a mix of Moroccan cuisine, cultural performances, and an inviting atmosphere. Guests often rave about the flavorful dishes, particularly the lamb shank served with mashed potatoes, which is praised for its tenderness. The eggplant appetizer and chicken tagine also received positive reviews, highlighting their authentic flavors. For dessert, the chocolate orange cake and crème brûlée were popular choices, although the chocolate cake was noted to be a bit dry. The inclusion of a belly dance show adds an exciting touch to the dining experience, although some patrons felt it could be more elaborate. The cozy tent seating with beautiful cushions enhances the overall ambiance, making it a unique venue for special occasions like birthdays. While the service is generally warm and attentive, some diners noted inconsistencies in recommendations. The drink selection, particularly the Sultans Mule, has received favorable mentions, contributing to the overall enjoyment of the meal. Although the restaurant leans towards the pricier side, many guests recommend it for those seeking an authentic Moroccan experience.

formattedAddress: 4K Spadina Ave., Toronto, ON M5V 3Z2, Canada
editorialSummary: Basic counter-serve joint offering Middle Eastern fare, including falafel, shawarma & kebabs.
reviews: This restaurant received mixed reviews regarding its food quality and service, primarily focused on the chicken shawarma. Guests praised the energetic service from Santiago and highlighted the daily specials, which are noted for their generous portions and quick service, making it a suitable choice for a casual meal. However, several reviewers expressed disappointment with their recent experiences, mentioning inconsistent portion sizes and subpar food quality, including overcooked rice and soggy vegetables. Many diners commented on the deterioration in the quality of the shawarma, noting issues such as hard, blackened meat and missing ingredients compared to their previous visits. While some enjoyed the rich and fresh flavors during their first visit, subsequent experiences fell short, leading to frustrations with both the taste and cleanliness of the establishment. Despite the restaurant's appeal for large portions and good service, several patrons indicated they would not return due to the decline in quality and preparation of the food. Overall, the restaurant seems to be a hit or miss based on the day and whom you are served by.

formattedAddress: 407A Bloor St E, Toronto, ON M4W 1H7, Canada
reviews: Pita Land provides a mixed dining experience, particularly for lunch and dinner. While some reviewers praise the freshness and taste of the food, highlighting dishes like the chicken shawarma and hummus, others express disappointment over portion sizes and value for money. A lunch special featuring rice, chicken, and sauce was criticized for offering poor value, while a dish of falafel received comments about its unsatisfactory quality. Although the service was noted to be friendly, some guests found it slow, with one instance taking 20 minutes to prepare three plates. While the options for toppings and sauces, along with the opportunity to request extra sauce, were appreciated, some diners felt that the food did not justify the prices charged. Overall, while the restaurant has its loyal patrons, several potential customers may reconsider returning due to inconsistent quality and value issues.

formattedAddress: 681 St Clair Ave W, Toronto, ON M6C 1A7, Canada
editorialSummary: An extensive menu of Middle Eastern tapas, with many vegetarian options, in a warm setting.
reviews: This restaurant has garnered mixed reviews, with some praising it as a hidden gem known for its extensive menu of mezze dishes, featuring a variety of vegetarian options and great prices. Diners have raved about the warm, cozy atmosphere, highlighting the fresh and flavorful cuisine as a standout. Popular dishes include the tapas, which theoretically should have showcased traditional flavors, but some critics found certain items, like the cold pitas and soggy patatas bravas, lacking in taste and preparation. Conversely, a visit for dinner reportedly offered an enjoyable experience with a generous spread of 15-16 small plates, creating a satisfying meal for three that cost about $100. Overall, the restaurant is noted for its friendly and attentive service, although there are concerns about the consistency of food quality and authenticity. For those seeking a lively dining experience with Mediterranean flair, this venue presents a mix of delightful and disappointing options, making it a place worth exploring, albeit with some caution.

formattedAddress: 44 Victoria St, Toronto, ON M5C 1Y2, Canada
reviews: Sultan's, located at the corner of Victoria St and Adelaide St, is a quick-service restaurant that offers a variety of Mediterranean dishes primarily focused on shawarma. Customers have enjoyed the Sultan's Mix, which features both chicken and beef shawarma, with the beef being notably more flavorful than the chicken. Accompaniments like hummus, garlic dip, and potatoes received mixed reviews; some found them delightful while others remarked on the dryness and blandness of certain items, particularly the rice and chicken. The salads provided were hit or miss, with one being well-received and the other less so. Portions are generally praised for their size but some diners felt the pricing, especially for entrees like the chicken shawarma at $16.50, was on the high side. A standout recommendation includes their falafel meal, described by one reviewer as among the best in the city. Overall, Sultan's presents a decent take-out option for shawarma although some customers suggest that the spice levels could be improved. Despite mixed experiences, a few diners expressed intentions to return for other dishes or to try different specials, such as the lunch wrap.

formattedAddress: 795 St Clair Ave W, Toronto, ON M6C 1B9, Canada
reviews: This restaurant has quickly become a neighborhood favorite, consistently impressing diners with its generous portions and delicious flavors. Patrons rave about the half and half meat plate featuring perfectly seasoned fluffy rice, garlic sauce, and hummus, alongside moist falafels and the delightful shish taouk, which is a chicken kabob loaded with juicy chicken chunks. The chicken shawarma, served on a fresh salad, is another standout dish that keeps customers coming back for more. Reviewers also highlight the exceptional quality of the ingredients, such as the zero-filler falafels rolled in sesame seeds and the fresh tabouli, providing a crisp and delicious experience. The ambiance is simple and traditional, attracting those who seek authentic and comforting meals rather than corporate dining. In addition to the tasty offerings, diners have expressed appreciation for the friendly and helpful staff who assist in navigating the menu. The unique touch of pomegranate sauce and seasonal spices like cardamom in the rice speaks to the restaurant's commitment to flavor and authenticity. Overall, this establishment is a must-visit for anyone craving satisfying Middle Eastern fare, whether for brunch, lunch, or dinner.

formattedAddress: 197 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5G 1C8, Canada
editorialSummary: Popular local chain outpost for falafels, shawarma wraps, combo plates & daily meal deals.
reviews: This restaurant is a popular spot for quick bites and takeout, especially for those craving Middle Eastern cuisine. Many reviewers mention the delicious shawarma, with one claiming it as the best they've ever had, noting the freshness of the ingredients. The chicken rice and sheesh kabab also receive compliments for their flavor and quality. While the service is generally praised, with staff like Sham providing excellent customer experiences, some guests have encountered communication issues when ordering. The atmosphere has been described as needing improvement, as the location appears unkempt and lacks the right vibe for dining in. Prices are considered reasonable, though some find certain dishes, like the beef wraps, to be slightly small for the cost. Overall, the restaurant is highly recommended for its healthy options and tasty meals, although it may be best to order ahead online to avoid any confusion.

formattedAddress: 890 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6G 1M5, Canada
editorialSummary: Popular local chain outpost for falafels, shawarma wraps, combo plates & daily meal deals.
reviews: This restaurant review provides a mixed bag of experiences across different dishes and meals. While one reviewer enjoyed a generous Beef Crazy Wrap combo with a perfectly cooked shawarma and crispy fries, another expressed disappointment with a "greek salad" that lacked essential ingredients like dressing, olives, and feta, offering only a handful of warm vegetables. The service appeared to be slow at times, with one customer waiting while the server chatted. Conversely, reviewers praised the welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff, including the manager who showed care for food preparation and customer service. The restaurant also offers a student special, although its price has risen from $6 to $10.50 over time. However, there were complaints about the falafel, with one customer deeming it the worst they'd ever tried and citing communication issues with staff. Ultimately, while some dishes are appreciated, others need significant improvement to enhance the dining experience.

formattedAddress: 155 Dundas St E Unit 1, Toronto, ON M5B 1E4, Canada
reviews: This restaurant is a hidden gem downtown, renowned for its delicious and fresh food, making it a popular choice for late-night cravings, quick lunches, or leisurely dinners. Their shawarma, especially the chicken shawarma nachos and wrap, is praised for its perfectly cooked meat and crisp veggies, complemented by flavorful sauces. Recently, they introduced a new waffle that has impressed many diners. The menu offers a variety of tasty options, ensuring there's something for everyone. Patrons consistently note the exceptional service, highlighting friendly staff who are attentive to customers' needs and hygiene practices. With a welcoming atmosphere and a clean environment, the restaurant provides a pleasant dining experience. Regular visitors, including one who frequents the establishment over 60 times in three months, attest to the restaurant's dedication to quality and customer satisfaction. Overall, this spot is highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy great food and service.

formattedAddress: 188 Eglinton Ave E #102, Toronto, ON M4P 2X7, Canada
reviews: Pitalite Shawarma is a hidden gem located in Yonge and Eglinton, known for its exceptional chicken shawarma plate and wraps. Diners rave about the delicious, tender chicken paired with fresh sides, making it a great choice for lunch or dinner. The restaurant boasts a welcoming atmosphere with modern decor and efficient service. Many reviewers highlight the attentive staff, particularly Dishant, who is praised for his charming personality and ability to remember customers' dietary restrictions. Families enjoy the generous portion sizes, with one guest noting it was the best shawarma they've had. The friendly service from the entire team – including Kaumil and Deep – enhances the dining experience, ensuring that every customer is taken care of. Whether you're stopping by for a quick meal or a leisurely dining experience, Pitalite offers healthy, fresh ingredients at reasonable prices, making it a must-visit for those in the area.

formattedAddress: 1430 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6K 1L9, Canada
editorialSummary: Popular local chain outpost for falafels, shawarma wraps, combo plates & daily meal deals.
reviews: This restaurant offers an authentic Middle Eastern dining experience that many patrons find reminiscent of home. The shawarma is highlighted as a standout dish, praised for its genuine taste, something diners have struggled to find elsewhere in Canada. The Crazy wrap, particularly when ordered with fries, is touted as potentially the best wrap ever, making it highly recommended for visitors. Despite some concerns regarding food temperature, with reports of cold chicken and lukewarm rice, the majority of reviews highlight the exceptional service and welcoming atmosphere. Specific praise goes to Omar, whose politeness and culinary skills elevate the overall experience, as well as Mohammed, whose wraps and falafels showcase impressive culinary talent. Diners appreciate the food's presentation and flavor, which reflect true Jordanian hospitality. However, some reviewers mention that the restaurant could benefit from a renovation, as cleanliness and decor could use improvement. Overall, the restaurant is recommended for those seeking delicious Middle Eastern cuisine.

formattedAddress: 373 Church St, Toronto, ON M5B 1Z9, Canada
reviews: The reviews reveal a concerning trend regarding the quality of food and customer service at this restaurant, particularly Lazeez Shawarma. Many diners expressed disappointment with their meals; one reviewer described the chicken beef combo plate as a “dry concoction” that lacked flavor, calling it a waste of nearly $20. Similarly, another customer lamented the chicken on sticks for being cold, dry, and lacking the extra garlic sauce they paid for, ultimately spending around $40 in vain. The poutine, once a favorite, has reportedly been reduced to a soupy consistency without cheese curds, leading to disillusionment for regular patrons. Complaints stretch beyond food quality, with a significant incident highlighting unprofessional behavior from staff who were rude and dismissive to a loyal customer trying to place an order late at night. Despite some good service experiences, concerns about the authenticity of positive reviews were raised, with suggestions that they might be skewed to favor the restaurant. Overall, patrons are left questioning the value and service quality, urging potential diners to reconsider before visiting, especially during busy hours.

formattedAddress: 131 Bremner Blvd, Toronto, ON M5J 3A7, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual, order-at-the-counter pit stop for Middle Eastern classics like shawarma, gyros & kebabs.
reviews: Pita and Grill has received mixed reviews regarding its dining experience. While some patrons appreciated the pleasant atmosphere and quick service, others were disappointed with the food quality and portion sizes. Dishes like the chicken and beef shawarma platters were criticized for being insufficiently sized despite their high prices, with one reviewer noting they paid $43 for what felt like a minimal amount of meat, rice, and salad. Another reviewer mentioned that their mixed platter, which was intended to serve a big family, only provided a few small pieces of chicken, leading to an overall unsatisfactory experience. Despite some praising the flavor of the food and the friendly staff, the general consensus is that the portions do not justify the cost, especially when compared to other shawarma restaurants. Customers were particularly frustrated by the absence of complimentary extra sauces, leading to a further sense of disappointment. Overall, while the restaurant offers a quiet ambiance and courteous service, many feel that the value for money is lacking, making it difficult to recommend returning.

formattedAddress: 102 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M5B 1G9, Canada
reviews: Pita Lands is a standout choice for a casual meal, offering an impressive variety of dishes including the amazing falafel wrap and the must-try Saj chicken wrap. Their chicken shawarma box is highly recommended, paired with flavorful sauces that elevate the dining experience. The restaurant also offers unique options like shawarma quesadillas and croissants, blending classic flavors with creative twists. While some customers have expressed concerns over promotional offers, the overall experience remains positive, particularly due to the attentive service from staff members like Shinan. The food quality and portion sizes are decent for the price, reflecting a higher level of care compared to other locations. Although prices may be on the higher side, patrons generally feel that the quality justifies the cost. For late-night cravings, this spot is a perfect choice, ensuring diners will likely leave satisfied. Whether for brunch or dinner, Pita Lands consistently delivers great flavor and friendly service.

formattedAddress: 565 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1M1, Canada
reviews: This restaurant has received mixed reviews, highlighting both positive and negative aspects of its offerings. Patrons have praised the generous portion sizes, particularly for dishes like the Beef Shawarma platter for around $20, but the taste often disappoints. One reviewer noted the shawarma was excessively sour, akin to being doused in lemon juice, which detracted from the meal's enjoyment. The sides, including lentils, chickpeas, and vegetable rice, were decent, yet the quality of the baklava left much to be desired, with comments on its toughness and lack of freshness. While some diners enjoyed the shawarma's flavor, another reviewer expressed serious concerns about food safety, mentioning raw chicken in their order. Additionally, diners found the washroom conditions unappealing, though the dining area itself was described as clean and comfortable. Overall, guests feel the restaurant has declined in quality over the years, with more emphasis on quantity rather than taste. Despite these issues, some loyal customers still frequent the spot after club outings, indicating a lingering affection for its offerings.

formattedAddress: 330 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3A4, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual choice offering up a traditional Middle Eastern menu featuring halal meats.
reviews: This restaurant is a popular choice for Middle Eastern cuisine, particularly known for its chicken shawarma and falafels. Many patrons enjoy the chicken shawarma wrap, which is praised for both its taste and generous portion sizes. The shawarma platter is also highlighted, featuring juicy chicken accompanied by a variety of fresh salads and flavorful sauces that enhance the dish without overwhelming it. While some reviews mention that the quality can vary, with one patron finding the chicken dry and the rice lacking flavor, the overall consensus leans towards a positive experience. The owner’s hands-on approach to preparing kabobs suggests a commitment to quality, which resonates in the tender beef and crispy pita chips served. Despite minor critiques, the restaurant's ability to prepare fresh food, especially during busy lunch hours, makes it a must-try for fans of Middle Eastern dishes. Overall, this spot comes highly recommended for those seeking a delicious and satisfying meal.

formattedAddress: 1283 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1N7, Canada
editorialSummary: Popular local chain outpost for falafels, shawarma wraps, combo plates & daily meal deals.
reviews: Ali Baba's has garnered positive reviews for its friendly and accommodating staff, creating a welcoming atmosphere for guests. Diners especially enjoyed the Sunday special, which includes two flavorful shawarma sandwiches for just $16, although some found the spice level intense. The restaurant's recent renovation has enhanced the dining experience, making it a more pleasant environment for enjoying the delicious Middle Eastern cuisine. The chicken shawarma and brown rice have received particular praise for their seasoning and flavor, while the crispy fries add to the overall appeal of the meal. Customers appreciate the generous portion of sauce on their dishes, enhancing the taste. With reasonable prices and good food quality, this restaurant is noted for offering satisfying meals whether for lunch or dinner. Overall, the positive feedback highlights Ali Baba's as a top choice for those craving authentic Middle Eastern dishes.

formattedAddress: 720 Spadina Ave., Toronto, ON M5S 2T9, Canada
reviews: Pita Land offers a mix of delicious options for lunch and dinner, with diners consistently raving about the chicken shawarma. The chicken shawarma dish, served in a plate or potato bowl, is often praised for its tender and flavorful meat, perfectly seasoned rice, and fresh salad, making it a satisfying choice. While most reviews highlight the fresh and tasty tabouli salad, one reviewer found their shawarma plate disappointing, describing it as greasy and lacking flavor. Service at Pita Land receives high marks as well, with one staff member noted for her multifaceted roles as chef, server, and cashier, contributing to the quick and friendly atmosphere. Despite some mixed feedback, the overall sentiment leans towards recommending the chicken shawarma as a standout dish. Diners appreciate the generous portion size and reasonable prices, along with the welcoming environment fostered by the friendly staff. If you're looking for a meal filled with vibrant flavors, Pita Land seems to be a promising choice for takeout.

formattedAddress: 215 Church St #4, Toronto, ON M5B 1Y7, Canada
reviews: The restaurant offers a variety of delicious and fresh dishes, with a welcoming staff enhancing the overall dining experience. Many highlight the quality of the meals, suggesting options such as eggs for breakfast and lasagna for dinner, which received positive feedback from satisfied patrons. However, not all reviews are favorable, as some customers express dissatisfaction, deeming the food to be subpar and not worth the cost. Despite mixed opinions, those who enjoyed their meals appreciate the attention to freshness and flavor. Overall, while some love the dining experience for breakfast and dinner, others find it lacking, emphasizing that experiences can vary significantly.

formattedAddress: 955 Eglinton Ave W, York, ON M6C 2C4, Canada
editorialSummary: Family-owned dining room with Middle Eastern food in a low-key space with take-out options.
reviews: This restaurant is praised for its beautiful establishment, excellent service, and healthy, delicious food. Diners can enjoy a variety of dishes, including lamb skewers with fries and salad, grilled eggplant, hummus, tabouleh, falafel, and fried eggplant. The combination dinner for two is noted for its incredible value, providing a wide selection of authentic Middle Eastern fare such as stewed tomatoes, chicken, beef, rice, and salad. While many reviews commend the food's flavor and quality, some guests have experienced slow service during busy times due to a lack of staff. Additionally, concerns have been raised about the freshness of the food during lunch and the automatic 15% gratuity added to bills, which surprised some patrons. The restaurant only accepts cash or credit cards, which has also been a point of confusion. Overall, families find it to be a great atmosphere with fast, friendly service, making it a cherished dining option for special occasions or casual meals. With outstanding dishes like fried eggplant, chicken skewers, and baklava, this establishment remains a favorite among locals.

formattedAddress: 430 College St unit 1/2, Toronto, ON M5T 1T3, Canada
editorialSummary: Counter service Turkish small & shared plates in an easygoing setting with red interior details.
reviews: This restaurant offers an impressive array of Middle Eastern dishes, with standout options for both lunch and dinner. Diners have praised the juicy chicken and beef plate, which is complemented by fresh salad and vegetables. The shawarma, particularly in the form of wraps and pide, has garnered rave reviews for its generous portions and flavorful sauces, including hummus and tzatziki. Guests have also recommended the baklava, noting its melt-in-your-mouth quality, though some have expressed disappointment with the portion size. The service has been described as friendly and accommodating, contributing to a pleasant dining atmosphere. Whether you're indulging in a hearty meal or enjoying a quick delivery via Uber Eats, this spot is highly recommended for fans of Middle Eastern cuisine. Overall, the restaurant delivers excellent food and a welcoming experience, making it a favorite among locals.

formattedAddress: 351 College St, Toronto, ON M5T 1S5, Canada
reviews: Osmow's Shawarma restaurant at College & Spadina offers a mix of positive experiences and some noted drawbacks. Many customers rave about the shawarma, particularly the chicken, which is often described as flavorful and well-cooked. Regular patrons appreciate the service provided by the supervisor, Arminder Singh, who is commended for his attentiveness and dedication to customer satisfaction, making each visit enjoyable. However, some customers have reported issues with the quality of takeout, mentioning greasy containers and a lack of clarity when it comes to dine-in service. While the garlic and tahini sauces are popular, there are mixed reviews about their accuracy in orders. The atmosphere is lively and the staff generally welcoming, although some have pointed out a lack of cultural representation among employees, which they feel could enhance the authenticity of the cuisine. Despite these inconsistencies, many recommend Osmow's for its delicious shawarma wraps and overall enjoyable dining experience.

formattedAddress: 302 Eglinton Ave W, Toronto, ON M4R 1B2, Canada
reviews: Sina Persian Grill in midtown Toronto has received mixed reviews from diners. While some customers praised the restaurant for its delicious dishes, such as the lamb shank served in a flavorful sauce and the chicken breast kabob, others reported a concerning issue with food safety. Multiple patrons experienced issues with the vaziri kebab, receiving raw chicken that led to food safety complaints and health concerns, including nausea and vomiting. On a positive note, the restaurant’s friendly service was highlighted, with one waitress even extending hours to accommodate guests. Additionally, the establishment has been commended for its portion sizes and quality, especially when catering for events, where dishes like the vegetarian khoreshte-gaime were well-received. Overall, while there are commendable aspects of the dining experience, the issues with raw chicken have raised significant alarm among many customers, urging potential diners to proceed with caution.

formattedAddress: 494 Front St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1H7, Canada
editorialSummary: Lebanese dishes plus coffee, pastries & groceries offered in a modern setting with soaring windows.
reviews: Souk Tabule Restaurant offers a delightful Middle Eastern dining experience perfect for anyone seeking flavorful dishes and a relaxed ambiance. Featuring a variety of options for vegetarians, the menu includes standout items like the chef’s tasting platter, falafels, batata harra, and the unforgettable beef shawarma. Guests rave about the Beruit pulled chicken and shish tawuk, both of which deliver delicious flavors and perfectly seasoned meat. The falafel served on rice is another highlight, praised for its satisfying crunch and aromatic spices. The restaurant's cozy atmosphere, inviting decor, and attentive staff enhance the overall dining experience. Whether you opt for a family platter or the meal for two option, the generous portions and excellent presentation ensure that you leave satisfied. Diners consistently rate their visits as memorable, making Souk Tabule a highly recommended destination for Middle Eastern cuisine lovers. Overall, the combination of delicious food, great service, and reasonable prices makes this restaurant stand out.

formattedAddress: 114 Atlantic Ave, Toronto, ON M6K 1X4, Canada
editorialSummary: Basic counter-serve joint offering Middle Eastern fare, including falafel, shawarma & kebabs.
reviews: The restaurant has received mixed reviews primarily focused on its shawarma offerings. Many customers expressed disappointment with the chicken shawarma, describing it as lacking flavor and containing an unappetizing amount of cabbage that overwhelmed other ingredients. Some reviews noted issues with packaging that made the wraps soggy and difficult to manage, especially when delivered through deals like the Uber Eats B1G1 offer. Although there were some redeeming qualities, like the solid chicken shawarma platter and tasty falafel, diners reported inconsistencies in quality, including dry chicken and cold sides. One patron even found an unexpected item in their meal, which was either seen as a quirky surprise or a cause for concern. While the prices were considered steep, especially for what was served, some still found value in the chicken shawarma sandwich and plan to return for daily specials. Overall, while the restaurant might serve as a quick late-night option, it is advisable to stick to more established local shawarma places for a better experience.

formattedAddress: 124 Danforth Ave, Toronto, ON M4K 1N1, Canada
reviews: This restaurant is a cozy spot praised for its friendly staff and generous portions of delicious food. Many visitors recommend trying the hummus, which received rave reviews for its taste, as well as the lamb and beef shawarma platter, notable for its special lamb flavor and crispy bread. The Greek platter, featuring a hefty serving of lamb, beef, and a fresh Greek salad, is also a favorite among patrons. Diners appreciated the late-night hours, making it an excellent choice for healthy meals around the clock. A standout dish for one group was the chicken saj, described as incredibly delicious with fresh ingredients and tender meat. However, there were some disappointing experiences reported, including incorrect orders and dry meat, leading to mixed reviews about the consistency of the food quality. Despite some negative feedback, the overall customer service and the cozy atmosphere seem to make it a worthwhile place for meals, whether for breakfast, brunch, or dinner. Many guests express their eagerness to return to this go-to spot during the summer.

formattedAddress: 155 University Ave, Toronto, ON M5H 3B7, Canada
editorialSummary: Wood-fired Neapolitan-style pizzas made with simple ingredients & served in a bustling space.
reviews: This restaurant has received rave reviews for its impressive selection of dishes, particularly its vegan options and delicious pizzas. Diners praised the house-made vegan cheese, noting its deliciousness even to those who typically enjoy real cheese. While the ambiance was described as clean and inviting, there were mixed reviews about specific pizzas; the Hawaiian pizza was deemed overcooked, while the mushroom pizza earned high praise for its chewy dough and aromatic flavor. Many guests appreciated the attentive service, with servers being knowledgeable about the menu and willing to recommend dishes. Options like warm olives, gnocchi fritters, and a mushroom pizza topped with homemade sausage were highlighted as standout choices. The bustling atmosphere adds to the dining experience, making it a must-visit for pizza lovers. Reservations are recommended, especially on busy weekends. Overall, this restaurant is a fantastic destination for anyone looking to enjoy a relaxed meal with great flavors.

formattedAddress: 104 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5C 2Y6, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: This affordable pizza spot is ideal for a quick meal, particularly if you're in the mood for a late-night snack. Customers rave about the tasty pizza, often noting that a single slice is more akin to two, making it a great value. The dough is described as soft and chewy, and the pizzas are reheated upon order, ensuring a crisp texture. While there was a hiccup with delivery service, as one customer faced issues with change, the pizza itself was praised for its high quality. With a varied menu that includes unique options like chicken pizza, this restaurant caters to diverse tastes. The clean environment and decent seating make it a comfortable place for dining in. Overall, it's a solid choice for those looking for affordable and delicious pizza, especially during dinner or late night.

formattedAddress: 289 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5T 1G2, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: This restaurant is known for its specialty Bianca pizza, which is freshly prepared in just eight minutes and features crispy dough with generous toppings. Many patrons have highlighted the cozy atmosphere and cleanliness of the space, creating a pleasant setting for meals at any time of day. The staff is generally described as kind and helpful, contributing to a welcoming experience for diners. While most reviews commend the quality of the pizza and the quick service, there was an unfortunate incident involving a disgruntled owner who harshly confronted a customer over restroom use, which led to a negative experience for some guests. Despite this, the restaurant offers great late-night dining options, making it a suitable choice for night owls. Prices are reasonable, with pizza slices available for $5 and $6 with a drink. Overall, while many customers enjoy the delicious pizza and friendly service, the behavior of the owner has left a troubling impression on at least one group of diners. Hence, the restaurant’s reputation is mixed, with a blend of tasty offerings and service-related concerns.

formattedAddress: 221 Ossington Ave, Toronto, ON M6J 2Z8, Canada
editorialSummary: Wood-fired Neapolitan-style pizzas made with simple ingredients & served in a bustling space.
reviews: This restaurant is a charming pizza spot that offers a mixed experience for diners. While some patrons rave about dishes like the amazing fried calamari with great sauce and gluten-free mushroom pizza, others find the regular pizzas soggy and lacking in flavor. The atmosphere is generally praised, along with the friendly wine selection assistance; however, service can be lacking after the initial order is taken. It's a casual dining experience with a self-service vibe, suggesting diners should be aware of the $5 surcharge for gluten-free options. A typical meal costs between $25-$50 per person, and sharing a large pizza is recommended for smaller groups. The Italian food offerings, particularly the gnocchi, receive high marks, and creative non-alcoholic drinks add to the appeal. However, not all visits have lived up to expectations, especially regarding the vegan pizza options, leaving some guests disappointed despite the beautiful ambience. Overall, this restaurant garners both enthusiasm and caution among its visitors.

formattedAddress: 1 Toronto St, Toronto, ON M5C 2V6, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: Pizzalio is a highly recommended restaurant for pizza enthusiasts, featuring a casual and welcoming ambiance perfect for enjoying meals with family and friends. The highlight of the menu is undeniably the pizza, which boasts a crispy yet chewy crust and generous, fresh toppings. Diners rave about the classic vegetarian option and the special Salami pizza, both of which are described as deliciously satisfying. Additionally, the garlic bread is a must-try, offering a warm and buttery taste with a perfect garlic kick. Service is noted to be friendly and efficient, whether for dine-in or online orders. Customers appreciate the reasonable prices for the quality of the food, with one reviewer noting a satisfying experience with two large pizzas for $56. Those seeking gluten-free options will also be pleased with Pizzalio's offerings, considered the best gluten-free pizza crust by one fan. Overall, Pizzalio presents a great choice for lunch or dinner, and many are eager to return for another slice.

formattedAddress: 772 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1V1, Canada
reviews: This restaurant offers an authentic Italian dining experience, showcasing a variety of delicious dishes perfect for dinner or a casual outing. Popular items include the wood-fired pizza, praised for its fresh ingredients, and arancini, which were described as "to die for." While the pasta, especially the pesto version, was noted as not having much flavor, the homemade variety received positive feedback for its cooking. The atmosphere is ideal for date nights or evenings with friends, though the absence of air conditioning can make dining uncomfortable on hot days. Some reviews mentioned concerns about the pizza crust being thicker than traditional Italian styles and occasionally undercooked. Service is generally regarded as attentive, but there can be delays in food delivery, resulting in mixed experiences. On Tuesdays, the restaurant offers a two-for-one pizza deal, making it an appealing option for those looking to try their menu. Overall, the combination of exceptional food and a warm atmosphere makes it a spot worth visiting.

formattedAddress: 302 College St, Toronto, ON M5T 1R9, Canada
editorialSummary: Corner counter-serve nook offering pizza pies & slices, plus calzones, pasta & salads.
reviews: Fresca Pizza and Pasta is gaining a reputation for its exceptional Italian fare, particularly its delicious pizza offerings, making it a popular choice for a quick and satisfying meal. The Margarita pizza stands out as a favorite among customers, praised for its fresh basil and addictive flavors, while the Hawaiian slice also received mention, albeit with mixed reviews regarding its generic taste. The affordable pricing, with slices starting at $5.00, has drawn in crowds, even on rainy days, highlighting its value proposition. Many diners appreciate the grab-and-go service, which complements the efficient and friendly customer service provided by the staff. The inviting ambiance allows for on-site seating, but the quick service option is particularly appealing for those in a rush. Guests are also encouraged to enhance their pizza experience with toppings like parsley garlic oil and chili flakes. Overall, Fresca Pizza and Pasta is quickly becoming a favored destination for both pizza aficionados and families seeking quality meals at reasonable prices. Customers express eagerness to return and explore more of the menu, especially the pasta selection, solidifying Fresca’s status as a must-try in the city.

formattedAddress: 650 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1E4, Canada
editorialSummary: Brooklyn-style whole pies & slices served in a casual industrial-chic space with beer & wine.
reviews: This restaurant receives mixed reviews, predominantly focused on its pizza offerings, which are popular yet vary in quality. The ultra-thin crust pizza, while crispy, lacks a distinctive taste, though many found the vegetarian mushroom topping flavorful, albeit a bit greasy. On the other hand, diners rave about the size and quality of their "Super DOUGH'PE" pizza, recommending it for its honest rustic flavors and the potential for leftovers. The pepperoni and Margherita pizzas are particularly highlighted as must-tries, with customers suggesting that dining in is preferable to delivery to truly enjoy the authentic taste. The New York cheese pizza also earns praise for its excellent flavor, especially with the addition of fermented hot sauce for spice enthusiasts. While the service could use some improvement, with longer than expected wait times during busy hours, the overall consensus is that this spot serves some of the best pizza around. Customers appreciate the casual atmosphere but warn that seating is limited, necessitating a wait during peak hours. Overall, it's a solid choice for pizza lovers seeking a delicious meal but be prepared for occasional service hiccups.

formattedAddress: 13 St Clair Ave W, Toronto, ON M4V 1K6, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: This restaurant is well-regarded for its delicious pizza, with many customers expressing their loyalty over the years. Though experiences can vary, most reviews highlight the quality of the pizza, particularly praising “The Sonny” and the unique vegan options featuring Yukon Gold potatoes. Many diners recommend this location for its consistently good slices and friendly staff. However, there are some complaints regarding pizza being burned or undercooked, which has led to frustration among regular patrons. Despite some occasional inconsistencies, the restaurant generally receives high ratings, especially for its toppings—like jalapeños—being generous. Overall, whether for casual dining with friends or a quick meal, this pizzeria seems to remain a favorite choice for pizza lovers.

formattedAddress: 995 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1M1, Canada
reviews: Maker Pizza has garnered mixed reviews from its customers, ranging from underwhelming experiences to enthusiastic praise. Some diners found their pizzas, particularly the mushroom and bacon variety, lacking in flavor, with a crust that was considered too chewy. However, those who enjoyed their meals highlighted favorites like Frank's Best and the Dr. Pepperoni, specifically lauding the unique addition of green olives and a sesame and honey crust that enhanced the flavor profile. Service at Maker received high marks, especially from patrons like Ashley, whose excellent customer service made a lasting impression. Many appreciated the efficient ordering process via the Maker mobile app and the intuitive pizza tracker that ensured timely deliveries. The overall atmosphere is described as small yet inviting, perfect for quick bites. Despite some reservations, many customers expressed a strong desire to return for another try, believing that a better experience awaits. With a blend of value, quality pizza slices, and welcoming service, Maker Pizza has established itself as a noteworthy option for pizza lovers.

formattedAddress: 1007 Eglinton Ave W, York, ON M6C 2C7, Canada
editorialSummary: Minimalist-chic eatery specializing in artisanal pizza, plus upscale pastas, soups & salads.
reviews: The restaurant is a bustling spot ideal for dinner, known for its vibrant atmosphere, though it can get quite noisy during peak hours. Diners rave about the wood-burning oven pizza, which is hailed as one of the best in the area, featuring a thin, delicious crust topped with fresh vegetables. The chicken dish is also highlighted for its scrumptious flavors, showcasing the kitchen's emphasis on quality ingredients. While customers were eager to indulge in the tiramisu, it was often sold out, creating an anticipation for a return visit. Those who did manage to try the dessert praised its delightful combination of sweet flavors and fluffy texture, enhanced with a splash of condensed milk and Espresso. The outdoor patio offers a pleasant dining experience, sheltered from the busy street by ongoing construction. Overall, guests appreciate the reasonable prices and the efficient service, reaffirming the restaurant's reputation as a top contender among pizza places in Toronto. Many are excited to return to explore more of the menu in the future.

formattedAddress: 37 Eglinton Ave E, Toronto, ON M4P 1A1, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: Pizzaiolo has garnered positive feedback for its friendly staff and gourmet pizza offerings, making it a popular lunchtime spot despite occasional crowds. The restaurant boasts a diverse selection of pizzas, including vegan and gluten-free options, loaded with toppings. Reviewers particularly enjoyed the calzone, noted for its size and cheesiness, and the honey heat pizza slice, which, while delicious, could have been served hotter. Despite some brunch service hiccups, such as order mix-ups and overcooked pepperoni, many patrons appreciated the customization options available. The staff, especially the pizza maker Mr. Abhijith, received praise for ensuring pizzas are prepared to individual preferences, making for an overall satisfying dining experience. The only suggestion from some customers was to add a bit more cheese to the pizzas. Overall, Pizzaiolo is recommended for its flavorful offerings and accommodating service, ensuring customers are likely to return for more.

formattedAddress: 964 Bathurst St, Toronto, ON M5R 3G5, Canada
editorialSummary: Rustic setting for wood-fired pizzas, salads & panini paired with wines, coffee & liqueurs.
reviews: This restaurant offers a delightful dining experience, particularly praised for its superb Italian cuisine, including a variety of pizzas that are served hot and fresh, along with a standout homemade hot sauce. Many guests appreciated the attentive service from staff members like Roberto and Shawn, who ensured their needs were met without delay, adding to the welcoming atmosphere of the establishment. Diners noted a particularly delicious dip served with fresh focaccia bread, which remains a well-kept secret of the restaurant. Whether attending for dinner after a graduation or a casual meal, customers enjoyed a well-designed, clean space that fosters relaxation and comfort, with soothing visuals enhancing the ambiance. Guests felt genuinely embraced by the staff, creating a memorable experience accentuated by generous portions and delicious in-house sauces. Overall, patrons highly recommend this restaurant for its impressive service and exceptional food, eager to return for more culinary delights.

formattedAddress: 500 Church St Unit 3, Toronto, ON M4Y 2C5, Canada
reviews: This restaurant has garnered mixed reviews, particularly for its pizzas and poutine. Many customers appreciate the delicious pizzas, which feature a wide array of topping options like truffled mushrooms and caramelized onions, with a consistent price of $13.45 for any size and toppings. The service is frequently highlighted as courteous and accommodating, with staff willing to create half-and-half pizzas, such as the Truffled Mushroom and Backyard BBQ Chicken. However, some have experienced issues with inconsistent ingredient portions, particularly in orders that arrived cold or lacking in flavor. One customer also expressed disappointment with the poutine, noting it was made from frozen potatoes and not up to par with the pizzas. Despite these setbacks, many patrons are willing to overlook the occasional issue, especially given the efficiency of service and the high quality of the pizza dough. Overall, this restaurant is particularly recommended for pizza lovers looking for unique flavor combinations in a clean and polite dining environment.

formattedAddress: 656A Spadina Ave., Toronto, ON M5S 2H7, Canada
editorialSummary: Basic pie parlor known for its array of massive slices dishes up casual Italian eats.
reviews: Tai’s Margherita pizza remains a standout dish for loyal customers, with many considering it a fan favorite despite the recent move to a new location at Cora’s pizza. While guests noted that seating is currently unavailable, the quick, affordable service makes it an ideal spot for students looking for a convenient meal across from campus. The menu offers a variety of fresh pizzas and reheated slices, including both the Margherita and Spicy Chicken options, which received positive mentions for their great taste and crunchy crust. The staff, especially a notable individual named Matthew, were praised for their exceptional service, particularly during an employee appreciation event where timely delivery and food quality were prioritized. However, some longtime patrons lamented the decline in pizza quality and size post-pandemic, leading to mixed feelings about future visits. Overall, the combination of friendly service, a varied menu, and affordability still makes it a notable choice for casual dining, though some customers feel it may no longer be worth the trip compared to other pizza places.

formattedAddress: 707 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4Y 2B2, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: The reviews for this pizza restaurant paint a troubling picture of both the food and service quality. Customers have expressed dissatisfaction with their meals, particularly noting that the pizza, including varieties like Hawaiian and pepperoni, was not fresh and was often served cold. One reviewer described a negative experience with the delivery service, stating that their order was left in the building lobby without notification, leading to complaints about the service overall. Additionally, many have criticized the restaurant's cleanliness, mentioning that tables were dirty and unwelcoming. Issues with staff attitude surfaced repeatedly, with patrons reporting that cashiers displayed rudeness and arrogance during interactions, which only compounded their negative dining experience. A long-time customer shared a particularly shocking encounter with what they deemed disrespectful service during a recent visit. Ultimately, multiple reviewers concluded they would not return to this establishment, urging others to reconsider their dining choices as well.

formattedAddress: 469 Church St, Toronto, ON M4Y 2C5, Canada
editorialSummary: Chill, contemporary eatery for thin-crust pies featuring seasonal ingredients, plus salads.
reviews: This takeout restaurant specializes in delicious thin crust pizza with a variety of customization options and a focus on high-quality ingredients. The online ordering process is user-friendly, and customers typically experience quick preparation times, often around half an hour. Among the standout pizzas, the "truffle shuffle" is a favorite, praised for its crispy, chewy crust and generous toppings, including a well-crafted pepperoni option. While garlic knots accompany the pizzas, the primary appeal remains the flavorful pies. Diners should note that this location does not offer seating, making it strictly a takeout spot, so it's advisable to call in advance to place orders, especially during busy hours. Despite occasional chaos during pick-up, the friendly staff ensure a smooth experience, occasionally throwing in complimentary pizzas for any mix-ups. Prices are reasonable, averaging around $25 for a medium pizza, making it an excellent choice for a casual dinner or gathering with friends. The overall ambiance, although not pristine, complements the welcoming vibe, solidifying it as a must-visit for pizza lovers in the downtown area.

formattedAddress: 2547 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4P 2H9, Canada
editorialSummary: Thin-crust pies, wings, sandwiches & pasta in a comfortable counter-service setting.
reviews: This restaurant offers a mix of lunch and dinner options, with standout dishes including the No. 16 specialty pizza, which receives high praise for its generous toppings and chewy cornmeal dough, and the flavorful veal parmesan pasta. However, the lasagna experiences mixed reviews; while it is described as decent, it suffered the drawback of being too soupy and, unfortunately, contained a short hair that prompted a discount from the staff. The pizza margherita and honey garlic chicken wings were less impressive, receiving lukewarm feedback. One reviewer also criticized the Spaghetti Bolognese for its meager portion of beef, calling it a joke. Service is noted to be good overall, although some experiences were marred by issues like a dirty plate which left a bad impression. Despite these inconsistencies, many guests appreciate the reasonable prices and consider it a great spot for a satisfying meal, particularly drawn back by the pizza. Overall, it appears to be a restaurant with potential, though improvements in quality and service may enhance the dining experience further.

formattedAddress: 181 Dovercourt Rd, Toronto, ON M6J 3C6, Canada
editorialSummary: Easygoing locale whipping up traditional pizzas with dips to eat in or take away.
reviews: Pizzeria Badiali in Toronto is renowned for its exceptional pizza, making it a must-visit for pizza lovers. The establishment offers a variety of delicious slices, including the spicy salami, vodka, pepperoni, and margarita pizzas, all praised for their spectacular sauce and crust. Patrons are advised to order ahead for full pies to avoid the long wait times, which can range from 20 minutes to over an hour, especially during weekends. Dining options are limited, with outdoor seating available but often quickly filled. Despite some guests suggesting improvements to the dipping sauces, the overall flavor profiles are highly appreciated. The friendly staff and charming decor add to the inviting atmosphere, making it a delightful spot for a relaxed meal. Whether you're grabbing a quick slice or indulging in a full pizza, the flavors and experience at Pizzeria Badiali are well worth the wait, especially on a chilly evening.

formattedAddress: 232 Wellington St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3W1, Canada
editorialSummary: Relaxed, snug eatery with soaring ceilings dishing out pizzas, pastas & subs, plus drinks.
reviews: This charming and unassuming restaurant provides a fantastic dining experience, particularly for dinner with friends or family. Customers have raved about the outstanding food, including an array of pizzas, pastas, and delectable appetizers. Guests particularly enjoyed the thin-crust pizza options, with choices like carne and vegetarian offerings that showcased authentic flavors. The penne dish also received high praise for its deliciousness. Desserts like the dulce de leche cheesecake and various house-made sweets were highlighted as the standout items, leaving a lasting impression on diners. The warm and welcoming atmosphere, complemented by attentive service from the charming server and owner, enhances the overall experience. While some patrons noted the distracting sports TV above the bar, this did not diminish their enjoyment of the meals, which were well-prepared and presented promptly. Many customers expressed their intention to return, solidifying this restaurant's reputation as a must-visit spot for excellent dinner options.

formattedAddress: 59 Cameron St, Toronto, ON M5T 2H1, Canada
editorialSummary: Trendy pizzeria with simple decor & a communal table serving up pies, hearty sandwiches & hot wings.
reviews: Maker Pizza in Toronto is known for its delightful offerings, particularly the Dr. Pepperoni and Tropic Thunder pizzas, which come loaded with generous toppings. Patrons appreciate the flaky crust and robust red sauce, although some reviewers noted that the cheese quality could improve, as it tends to be a bit greasy. Many customers enjoy visiting on Thursdays for the $3.75 slices and rave about the Spicy Vodka Pep, which has become a favorite. While the atmosphere can feel crowded due to limited seating, the service is often praised, with staff going above and beyond to ensure a pleasant experience, despite instances of less than enthusiastic cashiers. The shop is primarily a take-out spot, making it suitable for those looking for quick bites. Overall, while there are minor service inconsistencies and the marinara could use refinement, the flavor and quality of the pizza consistently shine through, making it a must-try for pizza lovers.

formattedAddress: 252 Dundas St E, Toronto, ON M5A 1Z8, Canada
reviews: George's Pizza is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic Montreal-style pizza, praised for its house-made sauce and buttery, cheesy dough. The menu features a variety of delicious offerings, including classic pizzas and the highly recommended panzzerotto with pepperoni. Customers have enjoyed the generous toppings and the perfect balance of flavors, which highlight Spiro's passion for crafting exceptional pies. The pizzas boast a delightful crust that combines softness and crunch, complemented by a tangy tomato sauce and a blend of savory cheeses. Beyond the outstanding food, the inviting atmosphere and friendly service enhance the overall dining experience, making it feel like a community hub. Many patrons appreciate the extra care taken by Spiro, from delivering complimentary cheese to sharing his story and love for pizza. Free delivery adds to the convenience, making it an ideal choice for both casual meals and takeout. If you’re in the area and looking for a comforting meal, George's Pizza promises a delightful experience that keeps customers coming back for more.

formattedAddress: 66 Gerrard St E Unit 100, Toronto, ON M5B 2M2, Canada
reviews: Pizza Maru offers a unique dining experience with its Korean-style pizza, blending sweet and salty flavors that create an intriguing fusion. The ambiance of the restaurant reflects its Korean roots, although finding parking can be a challenge. The service is friendly and accommodating, making newcomers feel welcomed, though a little more guidance on menu options would enhance the experience. Guests particularly enjoyed the cheese pizza, praised for its perfect dough, and highly recommended the seafood bay for Hawaiian pizza lovers. The honey butter fries also received positive remarks, adding to the savory experience. While the pizza portions are generous, some diners felt the fried chicken was overpriced for its small serving size. Unfortunately, some customers have noted uncomfortable dining conditions due to a lack of air conditioning, which detracted from their overall enjoyment. Despite these setbacks, many patrons expressed a strong desire to return and explore the restaurant's extensive menu, which offers numerous creative and delicious options for future visits.

formattedAddress: 188 Augusta Ave, Toronto, ON M5T 2L4, Canada
editorialSummary: Unassuming pizzeria offering thin-crust pies, pasta & local draft beer plus panini at lunch.
reviews: This restaurant offers a variety of pizza options, with the thin crust and chewy texture of their Margarita pizza receiving particular praise for its amazing dough and delicious flavors, although some diners wished for more sauce. However, the pizza's toppings tended to fall off, making it more suited for a knife and fork style of eating. The Diavola pizza had a good crust but was seen as below average in comparison to other establishments in Toronto, with some patrons experiencing slow service, especially for a group of 10 on a Monday evening. It's worth noting that the restaurant's cleanliness was criticized, particularly regarding the state of the washrooms. Additionally, one customer’s experience was marred by a miscommunication regarding dietary restrictions related to tomatoes, highlighting issues with staff attentiveness. On a positive note, the rice balls were well-received, and many visitors commented on the excellent, friendly service. Overall, the restaurant seems to offer flavorful dishes in a bustling city atmosphere, though diners should be mindful of service and communication challenges.

formattedAddress: 782 College St, Toronto, ON M6G 1C6, Canada
editorialSummary: Venerable family-run eatery offering Italian staples in a casual setting, plus takeout & delivery.
reviews: This Italian restaurant offers a delightful dining experience that is both affordable and enjoyable, making it a great choice for dinner. Guests have raved about the delicious cheese pizza, highlighting its amazing flavor and generous portion size. The service is generally good, with some patrons noting a need to request water a few times, but the staff's friendliness has received high praise. The ambiance is described as homey and beautiful, perfect for a casual night out. Diners can also expect complimentary bread served with butter, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar, enhancing the meal. Many have stumbled upon the restaurant while exploring Toronto and were pleasantly surprised by the quick service and attentive staff. Overall, the restaurant is highly recommended for its delightful atmosphere and quality Italian cuisine, promising a return visit for satisfied customers.

formattedAddress: Uptown, 1978 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M4S 1Z7, Canada
reviews: The restaurant is known for its Persian-style pizza, with dishes like the Beef Lover and Beef Supreme receiving high praise for their rich flavors and generous ingredients. However, experiences vary significantly among customers, with some enjoying the vibrant taste, while others complain about issues such as stale pizza, undercooked capsicums, and burnt pepperoni. In one review, a customer paid $32 for a pizza that turned out to be cold and took two hours to arrive, leading to frustration and disappointment. Another reviewer criticized the service, noting a long wait for their order and a billing issue involving an unauthorized tip addition by a server. Additionally, some diners found the pizza lacking in flavor, describing it as bland and overpowered by excessive cheese and garlic. The restaurant's ambiance has also been questioned due to a broken washroom and the choice to serve ketchup alongside pizza, which some find perplexing. Despite its charm, the establishment may need to address its service and quality inconsistencies to maintain customer satisfaction.

formattedAddress: 96 Gerrard St E, Toronto, ON M5B 1G7, Canada
reviews: This cozy pizza spot near Ryerson is a hidden gem known for its friendly service and spacious seating. Diners rave about the variety of pizzas, highlighting standouts like the signature veggie slice, margherita, chicken pesto, and the meat lovers, the latter being described as "unreal" with generous toppings, although some found it a bit salty. The thin and crispy crust enhances the flavorful pizzas, complementing them perfectly with garlic dipping sauce. Customers appreciate the cleanliness of the restaurant and its reasonable prices, with a large pepperoni special for takeout priced at $12.49 + tax. The fresh ingredients make all the difference, with reviews praising the freshness of both the veggie and chicken pesto pizzas, which are loaded with toppings. Many customers feel the veggie pizza's milder flavor is refreshing compared to saltier options. Overall, this mom-and-pop shop delights pizza lovers with its delicious offerings and attentive service, making it a must-try for anyone in the area.

formattedAddress: 372 Bay St., Toronto, ON M5H 2W9, Canada
editorialSummary: Signature pizzas, homemade pasta dishes & other Italian fare served in warm, informal dining space.
reviews: Za on Bay offers a cozy atmosphere with a wood-burning fireplace that enhances the dining experience. Diners have praised the wood-burning pizza and the Caesar salad with grilled chicken as standout dishes. The service is noted to be attentive and friendly, even though the restaurant may be a bit understaffed at times. Patrons enjoyed the truffle mac & cheese, along with various delicious pizzas like the Spicy House Sausage pizza and Mushroom pizza, which feature generous toppings and excellent crusts. Those who visited for brunch or an early dinner appreciated the quick food arrival and the quality of ingredients. A highlight of the meal for some was the tiramisu, described as the best they’ve had, especially because of its rich creaminess. Overall, guests have had very positive experiences, enjoying not just the food but also the cocktails and the welcoming staff. Many diners highly recommend returning for more delightful culinary offerings.

formattedAddress: 3 Rees St, Toronto, ON M5V 3J2, Canada
editorialSummary: Casual eatery for thick-crust pizzas with gourmet toppings, housemade sauce & gluten-free options.
reviews: Pizzaiolo is a popular spot for pizza aficionados, offering a mixed dining experience. While regulars appreciate the quick and satisfying slices, recent feedback highlights issues with food safety, such as flies near the pizzas and indifferent staff response when concerns were raised. The pizza quality has also come under scrutiny; some guests found the crust and toppings lacked the usual flair, while others praised the Pizzaiola pizza's delightful blend of tangy tomato sauce, garlic, and melted mozzarella on a thin, crispy crust. One reviewer enjoyed the Capone pizza, featuring chicken breast, red pepper, mushrooms, and pesto sauce, noting the fresh ingredients and pleasant crust. The restaurant offers indoor and outdoor seating, and while the service from the staff has been described as polite and friendly, there are peculiarities regarding drink combos, as bottled water isn't accepted. Despite its shortcomings, many still rate Pizzaiolo favorably, mentioning the good pizzas and friendly atmosphere, making it a convenient choice for locals. Overall, Pizzaiolo presents both culinary delights and areas needing improvement.

formattedAddress: 1033 Bay St. #9, Toronto, ON M5S 3A5, Canada
reviews: Sol Pizza is a charming little restaurant that offers an exceptional pizza experience, garnering rave reviews for both their food and service. Diners have praised the quality of their pizzas, particularly highlighting the delicious dough, generous toppings, and perfectly chewy crust. One customer was so enamored by the taste that they couldn't resist eating an entire box of pizza themselves.
